title: LINKIN PARK's Downgrades LA Show Due To Low Ticket Sales, Angers Brazilian Fans With Two Shows Removed
description: Things are not going super well, it seems. The post LINKIN PARK's Downgrades LA Show Due To Low Ticket Sales, Angers Brazilian Fans With Two Shows Removed appeared first on Metal Injection.
author: Greg Kennelty
byline: By Greg Kennelty Published 4 hours ago
excerpt: Things are not going super well, it seems.
text: Linkin Park's ongoing world tour seems to have hit a few minor snags. September 13 show in Los Angeles, which has been severely downgraded due to low ticket sales. The show was originally scheduled for the 56,000 capacity Dodger Stadium with Queens Of The Stone Age, but has now been moved to the 18,000 capacity Intuit Dome with JPEGMAFIA as the openers instead. According to Linkin Park, "If you purchased tickets previously [for the Los Angeles], you will be refunded & have first shot at buying tickets at Intuit Dome. Can't wait to see you there!" Then there's the fact that Linkin Park promised two shows in Rio de Janeiro and Porto Alegre, neither of which have surfaced. The shows were originally announced as part of Linkin Park's world tour for November 13 and 15 as "TBA" for the venue, but have since completely disappeared with no mention as to why. Oh, and then there's speculation that the tour isn't selling very well, as Linkin Park has launched a deal where fans can get two randomly selected seats for $39.50. That deal is available here. Linkin Park's ongoing world tour features guests like Queens Of The Stone Age, Spiritbox, AFI, Architects, grandson, Jean Dawson, JPEGMAFIA, and PVRIS on select dates. Get the remaining dates below (there are a lot of 'em). html:
Linkin Park's ongoing world tour seems to have hit a few minor snags.

September 13 show in Los Angeles, which has been severely downgraded due to low ticket sales. The show was originally scheduled for the 56,000 capacity Dodger Stadium with Queens Of The Stone Age, but has now been moved to the 18,000 capacity Intuit Dome with JPEGMAFIA as the openers instead. According to Linkin Park, "If you purchased tickets previously [for the Los Angeles], you will be refunded & have first shot at buying tickets at Intuit Dome. Can't wait to see you there!"

Then there's the fact that Linkin Park promised two shows in Rio de Janeiro and Porto Alegre, neither of which have surfaced. The shows were originally announced as part of Linkin Park's world tour for November 13 and 15 as "TBA" for the venue, but have since completely disappeared with no mention as to why.

Oh, and then there's speculation that the tour isn't selling very well, as Linkin Park has launched a deal where fans can get two randomly selected seats for $39.50. That deal is available here.

Linkin Park's ongoing world tour features guests like Queens Of The Stone Age, Spiritbox, AFI, Architects, grandson, Jean Dawson, JPEGMAFIA, and PVRIS on select dates. Get the remaining dates below (there are a lot of 'em). Tickets are available here.
